description.value:
When a creature that can see the %TOKENNAME%'s central eye starts its turn within 30 feet, the %TOKENNAME% can force it to make a WIS Save if %TOKENNAME% isn’t incapacitated and can see the creature. A creature that fails the save is @JournalEntry[Ch02WiipJvf69EDN]{Stunned} until the start of its next turn.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes (making the creature effectively @JournalEntry[lIPpTxLdMS9z2G94]{Blinded} relative to %TOKENNAME%)  at the start of its turn to avoid the saving throw.

If the creature does so, it can’t see %TOKENNAME% until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at %TOKENNAME% in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

FoundryVTT: Targets averting eyes can be manually marked with the blinded effect. A dialog will offer all in range tokens that have a line of sight to the Gauth and then proceed with saves and apply appropriate effects.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

data.name: Stunning Gaze
data.author: ZjFlOWYxZjM5ZTZj
